meanings.sent1: I will redisplay the painting in the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: After the event, they decided to redisplay the decorations for the next party.
meanings.sent3: The magician redisplayed the disappearing act, but this time with a twist.
meanings.sent4: She redisplayed her emotions on her face, like a canvas for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the student to redisplay the correct answer on the board for everyone to learn from.

meanings.definition: The act of displaying something again.
meanings.sent1: The redisplay of the artwork attracted many visitors to the museum.
meanings.sent2: The redisplay of the old photographs brought back fond memories for the family.
meanings.sent3: The redisplay of the trophy case made the school hallway look more impressive.
meanings.sent4: The redisplay of the antique vase in the store window caught the eye of every passerby.
meanings.sent5: The redisplay of the historical artifacts in the exhibit made history come alive for the students.
